author: A_Brickset_user
title: finaly mine!
review:
Just found this set on a dusty shelf in some cheap toystore for the price of 80 euro's !
Offcourse i couldnt resist and had to have this one in my collection.
In fact , a friend of mine and me were planning to order several of these sets over the internet.
And now that i own 1 of these sets,i can say i want at least 3 more.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great "sleeper" set!
review: What this set doesn't show you on the front of the box is that it comes with a pulling sled and electric motor set. For under $100 US, you get a battery box and motor, 20 pistons/cylinders and alot of chain. To get this much chain in one place, you would have to go to Pitsco, but with this set, you get much more. I liked this one so much I bought two for pulling competitions. you can even add an additional(not included) electric motor to give your puller more power.The pulling sled works very life-like, as it advances forward as the puller moves forward, thus putting more weight on the hitch point. It also includes an interesting video about the Lego sponsored tractor pulling team.

author: jsmtrspts
title: Realalistic set
review: When I got this set it was pretty cool. It acted like the real deal, but i thought it was a little under powered, So I bought another motor kit. That pulled the sled and then some. I played around with the different gear sets. Later on I ordered the tach for it. What a great set.
